properties.areaDesc: Coastal Waters of Northern USVI and Culebra out 10 NM
properties.headline: Small Craft Advisory issued February 10 at 10:23AM AST until February 12 at 8:00PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
...Rough and hazardous marine conditions will prevail during the
next few days...

.A potent surface high pressure across the central Atlantic will
yield a fresh to locally strong easterly wind flow across the
regional waters, creating hazardous marine conditions through
at least midweek.

* WHAT...Seas between 4 to 7 feet with occasional seas up to 8
feet. East winds between 15 to 20 knots with higher gusts.

* WHERE...Eastern portion of the coastal Waters of Northern USVI
and Culebra out 10 NM.

* WHEN...Until 8 PM AST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Conditions will be hazardous to small craft.
properties.instruction:
Inexperienced mariners, especially those operating smaller
vessels, should avoid navigating in hazardous conditions.

NWSheadline: SMALL CRAFT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM AST WEDNESDAY
